course_title: Seminar: 17th c./18th c. Art/Arch: Picturing History, 1400-1700
class_notes:
What is a history picture?  In art theoretical writing, the nexus amongst invention, imitation, and the historia, far from being treated as self-evident, was subject to constant revision.  What do these texts and related images they tell us about the nexus between historical invention and ordonnance, between evidentiary history and fictional poetry, between the historical scopus (center of interest) and its ornaments, between history and the other pictorial genres?
Class will meet at The Fox Center (1635 North Decatur Road) in the seminar room, room 101.
course_description: Advanced seminar on 17th and 18th century art and/or architecture with emphasis on critical texts, methods, and techniques of art historical investigation. For art history majors; open to others with permission from the instructor.
